fifo_queue



class FifoQueue;
Auto resizeable FIFO (First In First Out) container that stores char[] type. Overflow shouldn't happen becouse capacity will grow. Underflow is handled by returning empty string. Capacity can only grow and unused data is overwritten, not cleaned up.

TODO:
if canister could shrink unneededcapacity , free unused indexes to reduce memory load

void put(char[] data);
Stores string.

char[] get();
Gets string. If no more left, return empty string.

uint length();
Number of stored strings at the moment (number of get() methods you can perform).

uint capacity();
Max number of strings canister can store at the moment. It will grow automatically if space is needed. Starting capacity is 16 and grows by factor 2 (doubles).

char[] toString();
Returns convenient debug message describing object (capacity, length, position of indexes etc.).
